report_title: BBQ & Outdoor Cooking Stores in the US
executive_summary: The BBQ and Outdoor Cooking Stores industry has been rekindled over the past five years. Rising per capita disposable income and leisure time have revived discretionary purchases on outdoor cooking equipment such as barbecues (BBQs), smokers and related accessories. As the economy continues its recovery, consumers have higher propensity to purchase new equipment to replace the aging equipment that they already own or purchase secondhand items. Equipment sold by operators tends to have a relatively long lifespan but is susceptible to wear and tear, so consumers continue to replace or upgrade outdoor cooking equipment every few years. Although economic conditions deteriorated amid COVID-19, a spike in at-home cooking and stay-at-home orders have bolstered demand. These trends caused revenue to heighten at a CAGR of 2.9% to an estimated $9.6 billion through the end of 2023, including a drop of 1.9% in 2023, driven by growth in residential construction and outdoor cooking upgrades as the economy continues to recover post-pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: BBQ and outdoor cooking stores are expected to endure revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: BBQ and outdoor cooking stores are expected to endure revenue growing at a CAGR of 2.9% to an estimated $9.6 billion over the past five years, including a 1.9% fall in 2023, when profit is poised to reach 3.2%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Mixed Economic Conditions Amid COVID-19 Provide Net Benefit For Operators
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Although broader economic conditions suffered significantly during COVID-19, the shift toward at-home cooking and a booming residential market bolstered outdoor cooking stores.

Big-box retailers, such as Costco Wholesale Corp., account for the largest share of revenue. However, rising incomes and a larger market for luxury goods have enticed many new niche businesses into the marketplace. These trends, coupled with growing online availability, heightened competition for operators. Despite numerous small specialty operators entering the industry during the five-year period, big-box retailers remain core controllers of their share of revenue. This caused profit to inch upward as these operators benefit from high levels of economies of scale.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: BBQ and outdoor cooking stores are expected to endure revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: BBQ and outdoor cooking stores are expected to endure revenue growing at a CAGR of 1.6% to an estimated $10.3 billion over the next five years, with the profit margin poised to reach 3.1% in 2028.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Economic Recovery Following COVID-19 Will Bolster Core Revenue Channels
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As economic conditions fully recover following COVID-19, consumers will continue to have high propensity in purchasing outdoor cooking equipment, either as new or replacement items. An expected growth in per capita disposable income and broader consumer spending will fuel demand for outdoor grills and accessories, particularly more high-end models among wealthier consumers. With inflationary pressures poised to dampen in the coming years, younger consumers will have more fiscal flexibility in procuring the latest grills and outdoor cooking accessories, further boosting revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continuous Demand for Outdoor Grilling Poised to Establish Niche Demand Channels
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The continuity in popularity of outdoor grilling, particularly after the pandemic, ensures operators have a steady and diverse consumer base. With the broader population set to continue aging in the coming years, it will provide operators with a large and consistent consumer base that will look to maintain and acquire grilling equipment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: High Level of Price Competition Poised to Dampen Large-Scale Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As big box retailers look to secure a growing market base, outdoor cooking operators will have to establish competitive pricing that can preserve profitability and ensure future growth. The prevalence of outdoor cooking and grilling in suburban communities is a growing market that may open new revenue channels, particularly for luxury grills and smokers. Nonetheless, the prevalence of localized brands and continued proliferation by big box retailers ensures large-scale growth opportunities are limited.

industry_definition: Barbecue and outdoor cooking stores retail barbecue grills and related accessories. A limited number of retailers only sell barbeque equipment and, as a result, home improvement stores, department stores and supercenters sell the majority of industry goods. Stores that sell equipment exclusively online are excluded from the industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 45 to 54. This is the largest segment within the market that has a consistent revenue stream for operators, as consumers within this age category have the most balance between leisure and work. Strong economic conditions have also benefited this segment, with many wealthier consumers in this age group having more opportunities to acquire luxury grills and additional accessories.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 35 to 44. Consumers within this age bracket have a much higher propensity to acquire their own home, which creates consistent demand for outdoor grilling accessories and grills. As economic conditions continue to improve and the rate of homeownership inches upward, more consumers within this age category will be interested in upgrading their homes with grilling equipment.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 25 to 34. Consumers within this age bracket have more income at their disposal, as many of them are of working age and have a higher level of fiscal flexibility to acquire a new grill or outdoor cooking accessories. Recent growth in disposable income, coupled with a strong employment situation nationally, has benefited this age group and fueled a larger quantity of sales among these consumers.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers under the age of 25. Many consumers within this age bracket are younger customers that have significantly less fiscal flexibility and are more financially dependent on their parents. Although most consumers lack their own household, they are buyers of smaller equipment and accessories, a trend that has grown in recent years as economic conditions improved following COVID-19.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers aged 65 and older. Most consumers within this age bracket are of retirement age and have the highest amount of leisure time, which suits outdoor cooking and grilling as a leisure activity. Nonetheless, despite aging in the broader population, the negative economic impact of inflation post-pandemic caused many older consumers to cut back on new grill purchases, as they have fixed incomes.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 55 to 64. Older consumers that are still in working age have the highest level of financial strength, while also having significant leverage in the real estate market. The convenience of having grills and accessories within the home creates a constant demand niche among these consumers, particularly as they have higher propensity to eat at home.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue via the sale of gas grills. Gas grills require the input of either liquid petroleum or natural gas for fuel and are considered one of the most popular and commonplace grills across the United States. The durability and diversified use of gas grills, which can be used either as a cart or flattop design, creates an extra level of convenience and ease of usage. Nonetheless, high inflation following COVID-19 caused the cost of gas and the grills themselves to dampen demand among core consumer groups, harming revenue generated via this segment.

This product segment generates revenue via the sale of charcoal grills. Charcoal grills are considered the most popular grill on the market due to its slow cost, ease of use and better tasting food after use. These grills are powered via charcoal briquettes or all-natural lump charcoal, which does make cooking the food a longer process, but also makes it tastier. High inflation influenced many consumers to switch to charcoal grills, as they are less expensive to use and have lower maintenance costs.

This product segment generates revenue via the sale of electric grills. Electric grills have less popularity among consumers due to the lack of burned fuel usage for heat generation, with the cost of usage also more expensive. As charcoal and gas grills remain high in popularity and provide excellent taste for food, revenue generated from electric grill sales continues to be relatively small.

This product segment generates revenue via the sale of wood pellet grills. Wood pellet grills are an alternative form of outdoor grills that continue to grow in popularity due to their ease of usage and versatility of cooking, grilling, baking, roasting and braising. These grills use hardwood pellets to fuel the grill itself, making them a popular choice among consumers looking for the best flavor. A sudden spike in prices of lumber post-pandemic exacerbated the costs associated with using these grills, which dampened sales within this segment.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Other Outdoor Cooking Tools and Accessories
products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue via the sales of outdoor cooking tools and accessories, such as knives, spatulas, cutting boards, carving forks, tongs, heat shield, salt blocks and valves. This variety of accessories and cooking tools provide maximum convenience for grill owners and enable a more efficient cooking process. Although these accessories are in high demand and disposable income has risen, the prevalence of alternative shopping sites and price-based competitors influenced lower revenue generated from this segment.

business_locations.location_description: For barbecue and outdoor cooking stores, operating near highly populated areas provides the best access to a diversified customer base, making the Southeast a hotspot.
Although the Great Lakes has a significantly colder climate, it does house significant corporate retailers, such as Costco Wholesale Corp., which supply a significant demand niche for establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic houses a significant portion of establishments due to the popularity of outdoor grilling during the summer and spring seasons.

Although the Southwest lacks significant metropolitan centers, it continues to endure a significant rate of growth of suburban communities with wealthy customers that have the fiscal flexibility to afford outdoor grills.
The Western region houses a smaller portion of establishments, although it continues to be a popular location due to the high saturation of population centers.

Some of the other regions with a significantly smaller share of establishments include the Plains, the New England and the Rocky Mountains regions. These areas lack a significant population presence and have considerably colder weather, discouraging outdoor activities on a frequent basis.
